98229.name: Humanitarian Aid (million 2016 USD)
98229.description:
Within the overall definition of official development assistance (ODA), humanitarian aid is assistance designed to save lives, alleviate suffering and maintain and protect human dignity during and in the aftermath of emergencies. To be classified as  humanitarian, aid should be consistent with the humanitarian principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality and independence.

Humanitarian aid includes: disaster prevention and preparedness; the provision of shelter, food, water and sanitation, health services and other items of assistance for the benefit of affected people and to facilitate the return to normal lives and livelihoods; measures to promote and protect the safety, welfare and dignity of civilians and those no longer taking part in hostilities and rehabilitation, reconstruction and transition assistance while the emergency situation persists. Activities to protect the security of persons or property through the use or display of force are excluded. Includes aid to refugees in developing countries, but not to those in donor countries.of which: Relief food aid comprises supplies of food, and associated costs, provided for humanitarian relief purposes.

source.name: Humanitarian Aid received (OECD, 2018)
source.dataPublishedBy: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
